title: Instructional Design Scenarios for Strengthening Consistency in Online Nursing Bachelor’s Programs

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Learner role: Administrator/Leader, Domain expertise: Beginner, Subject/Job field: Mathematics, Assessment method: Summative assessment-focused, Technology environment: Limited-technology environment (no PC, smartphone-based)

learning_goals: Applying the ADDIE model’s five phases (Analysis, Design, Development, Implementation, Evaluation) and the five characteristics of Diffusion of Innovation Theory (relative advantage, compatibility, complexity, trialability, observability), learners draft an online nursing course design framework within three days, incorporate at least two rounds of peer feedback, and submit the final version.
Ensure both standardization and flexibility of educational content by utilizing LMS templates and assessment rubrics.
Establish navigation structure optimization and workload reduction strategies to improve online learning experiences for learners (nurse managers).

resources: Humor-Enhanced Educational Materials (e.g., Puns in PPT)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
